page.title: 10RIDING AT PINKNEY'S STABLES.
page.content: My name is Rebecca Hall. On Saturday mornings I go riding at Pinkney's Green Stables. When I get there the horses are just being groomed. Then they have to be tacked up, that means putting on their saddles, harnesses and reins. We all choose the pony that we want to ride, and go up into the nearby woods. We stay out for about an hour. While we are out we make the ponies trot, jump, and do lots of different exercises. When we get back to the stables, we have to un-tack the ponies, and then let them run in the field. They like to have a drink and some hay. There are 19 ponies at the stables, which is owned by Meg Stanton. It costs Â£3.50 per person to ride. Some of my favourite ponies are: Smudge, Jasper, Tammy and Banner.
